intro: Senecio thamathuensis, commonly known as the Thamathuensis Groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
